title: Chord: 11th in D (Shape: C)
content:
# Chord: 11th in D (Shape: C)

The 11th chord is a four-note chord that adds an 11th note to a major or minor triad. In the key of D, when playing an 11th chord with a C shape, it creates a rich and colorful sound due to the extension of the 11th note.

## Notes and Intervals:
- D (Root)
- F# (Major 3rd)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- G (11th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre:
The 11th chord, especially in the key of D played with a C shape, brings a jazzy and sophisticated flavor to music. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and soul music to add depth and complexity to chord progressions. The 11th chord creates a dreamy and atmospheric vibe, making it suitable for emotional and expressive musical pieces.

## Example Songs:
1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Unchain My Heart" by Ray Charles
